content: of data in certain use cases has challenged their cost-effectiveness and ability to maintain SLAs for downtime, recovery, and response times. 10.3.1 Current pattern in banking on analytic use cases Data management typically involves three key layers:  Data ingestion services: Both streaming and batch processing are used to ingest data.  Data stores: Data is stored in various formats, including data lakes and data warehouses.  Lineage and governance: While less emphasized due to a lack of well-integrated services, lineage and governance are crucial for data quality and compliance. Figure 10-1 shows current pattern in banking on analytic use cases.
